result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Glen S Tessman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED on 04-23-2015: Credit for Time Served is 265 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine, Cost and Fee to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision at the rate of $150.00 per month starting the 4th month of Extended Supervision.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 to be paid to Waukesha County Clerk of Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Be involved in a 12 step program within 30 days and within 60 days obtain a sponsor/mentor.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Count #2 was Dismissed.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

superTimeConds.notes: In a drug/alcohol rehabilitation service each year with the Last 20 hours to be completed within the Last 90 days of Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting with the First 6 months of release onto Extended Supervision.

Court is concerned and revokes bail for reasons stated on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Hearing on June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Any Vehicle that Defendant operates is to be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Defendant is to report to huber facility immediately and is only to be released for work and treatment between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m.

State objects to any bail modification/reduction.  Court modifies/converts bail to a $25,000.00 signature bond with a few added conditions.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
